translated: Jātaka: The Group of Discourses with Doubles🔽The Group of Discourses with Shoes

original: “Kāmaṁ yahiṁ icchasi tena gaccha,🔽Viddhosi mammamhi vikaṇṇakena;
analyzed: kāmam yahim icchasi tena gaccha  viddhaḥ asi vikaṇṇakena
translated: “Go wherever you want, as you please,🔽You’re pierced by me with an ear-ring;
You’re killed by me with a well-spoken word,
And you’re foolishly following the fish.”
“In the same way, one who flies down to the world’s bait,
Is tormented, following the mind’s control;
He’s killed in the middle of his relatives and friends,
Like the crocodile following the fish.”
The Discourses with the Ear-ring, the third.
